## Resources

<br> 

[**These resources**](http://ohi-science.org/news/Resources-for-R-and-Data-Science) helped us learn open data science practices and tools. They are developed and used by a welcoming, inclusive community and are all available online for free. 

[**These references**](http://ohi-science.org/news/importance-of-open-data-science-tools) in the academic literature and media discuss the importance of open data science tools in science.

## Community

#### We are passionate about building the environmental data science community!

<br>

<div class="col2">

<br>

![](figures/nature_graphic_ohi_smith.jpg)

We think that by embracing existing tools and systems we can more efficiently find environmental solutions, together. 

Please use our [Ocean Health Index training materials](http://ohi-science.org/training/) to learn open data science practices and see these tools used in the context of environmental science and management.

You can also check out our skill-sharing and community-building study group: [eco-data-science](http://eco-data-science.github.io/). 

<br>
